bug.short_desc: Application to test is not check if its loaded correctly

long_desc.thetext:
At the moment it could happen that the application to test is not loaded correctly when a script error occurs on loadtime. The problem is that the Testrunner does't checks it before tests are executed.
I would expect that the Testrunner checks if the application to test is correctly initialized before one test is running. We try to run our test with the console view and PhantomJS. When the application to test is not initialized correctly a inconsistent version is tested and the test result is confusing.
I talked with Daniel an idea to use an own loader for the application to test, which checks if everything is loaded correctly. Otherwise the Testrunner logs an error.
